comments.text:
Created attachment 542623
Crash_Firefox5.htm

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.30; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.648; .NET CLR 3.5.21022; InfoPath.2)

Steps to reproduce:

There you can see the code/html as example as proof of concept.

http://xss.evilcode.com.ar/FireFox/Crash_Firefox5.html



Actual results:

When you open the example, the Firefox 5 presents a Denial of Service, and then it will crash.The issue is because  Firefox doesn't  handle the Canvas tags,in this new version,5.x-




Expected results:

Firefox should handle this " tags html canvas"without error as Chrome-

comments.author: joe@drew.ca
comments.text: This certainly hangs my browser. I haven't yet reproduced a crash, though.
comments.creator: joe@drew.ca
comments.raw_text: This certainly hangs my browser. I haven't yet reproduced a crash, though.

This hangs in cairo's bentley-ottman tesselator, spending almost all time in _cairo_bo_point32_compare on Mac. It's possible that this is related to bug 664930.

I'm leaning towards [sg:dos] though I haven't yet seen a crash. Ivan, do you have a link to any of your crash reports? You can go into about:crashes and copy those entries into this bug report.
comments.author: joe@drew.ca
comments.text:
This hangs in cairo's bentley-ottman tesselator, spending almost all time in _cairo_bo_point32_compare on Mac. It's possible that this is related to bug 664930.

I'm leaning towards [sg:dos] though I haven't yet seen a crash. Ivan, do you have a link to any of your crash reports? You can go into about:crashes and copy those entries into this bug report.
